meanings.definition: A person who studies and compares different societies or cultures.
meanings.sent1: The comparativists analyzed the customs of various tribes.
meanings.sent2: Many comparativists enjoy exploring the differences between Eastern and Western philosophies.
meanings.sent3: The comparativists joked that they could write a book on the similarities between cats and humans.
meanings.sent4: She was a comparativist, always finding connections between seemingly unrelated traditions.
meanings.sent5: The group of comparativists traveled the world to observe cultural practices firsthand.

meanings.definition: Those who engage in the practice of comparing different things or ideas.
meanings.sent1: As comparativists, they constantly sought to draw parallels between historical events.
meanings.sent2: The team of comparativists compared the effectiveness of different teaching methods.
meanings.sent3: The comparativists playfully debated which superhero had the most impressive powers.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, she saw the world as a giant puzzle waiting to be solved by comparativists.
meanings.sent5: The group of comparativists gathered to discuss their latest findings on consumer behavior.
